data.description: Introduction to economic ways of thinking about a wide range of problems and issues. Topics include consumption, production, prices, markets, finance, trade, pollution, growth, farms, taxes, and development.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AGRICULTURAL AND APPLIED ECONOMICS

data.description: Provides training in the analytical skills and tools needed to comprehend, assess, and address complex public policy decisions. Overview of the theory and application of quantitative and qualitative analysis methods relevant to public policy decision-making and policy analysis.
data.title: ANALYTIC TOOLS FOR PUBLIC POLICY
